disease: Gonococcal infection of lower genitourinary tract with periurethral and accessory gland abscess

symptoms.name: Purulent or mucopurulent urethral discharge
symptoms.pattern: Present in most symptomatic men; can be clear or cloudy in some

symptoms.name: Periurethral abscess
symptoms.pattern: A cavity filled with pus in the tissue around the urethra

symptoms.name: Accessory gland abscess
symptoms.pattern: Abscess in accessory glands (e.g., Tyson's glands)

symptoms.name: Painful urination
symptoms.pattern: Can occur with inflammation of the urinary tract or genitals

symptoms.name: Pus-filled discharge
symptoms.pattern: Can occur with inflammation of the urinary tract or genitals

symptoms.name: Dyspareunia
symptoms.pattern: Painful sexual intercourse, can occur in women

symptoms.name: Mucopurulent or purulent cervical discharge
symptoms.pattern: Can be observed on cervical examination in women

symptoms.name: Bleeding of the cervix with minimal contact
symptoms.pattern: Can be observed on cervical examination in women

symptoms.name: Unilateral testicular pain and swelling
symptoms.pattern: Occurs in men with epididymitis, a less common complication

physical_findings: Unilateral testicular pain and swelling (men with epididymitis)

Gram stain.abnormal: Polymorphonuclear leukocytes with intracellular gram-negative diplococci (symptomatic men)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with gonococcal infection of the lower genitourinary tract
Positive NAAT or culture for N. gonorrhoeae
supportive: Gram stain showing polymorphonuclear leukocytes with intracellular gram-negative diplococci (symptomatic men)
